description: The threat actors gained initial access through a brute force attack against the MSSQL server's "sa" account.

technique: T1059.003 - Command and Scripting Interpreter: PowerShell
description: The threat actors used "xp_cmdshell" to execute a PowerShell command establishing a connection to their Cobalt Strike command and control server.
The threat actors injected code into the winlogon.exe process, potentially using CreateRemoteThread, to gain elevated privileges.
The threat actors disabled antivirus solutions like MalwareBytes, Sophos, and Windows Defender to hinder detection.

technique: T1564.001 - Hide Files or Information: File System Metadata Removal
description: The threat actors used techniques to remove file system metadata, potentially to hide their presence.
The threat actors attempted to remove indicators of their activity from tools and systems.
The threat actors created scheduled tasks to maintain persistence on the compromised systems.
The threat actors used Remote Service creation to move laterally from the initial target to domain controllers and file shares.
The threat actors conducted network service scanning using Invoke-SMBExec to gather information about the network topology.
The threat actors deployed the BlueSky ransomware, encrypting files on the network and causing a significant impact on the organization.
